Key Match Events: Ajdin Hrustic scored the opening goal in the 29th minute courtesy of a deflected long-range shot.
Kusini Yengi added the second goal in the 62nd minute with a header from a fantastic Jordy Bos cross from the left.
Pre-Game Insights: Nestory Irankunda was handed a shock starting debut.
The Socceroos dominated possession as Bangladesh sat deep but recorded just four shots on target from 15 attempts.
Post-Match Reflections: The Socceroos will be disappointed that they didnâ€™t score more goals.
Conditions were tough, the pitch was terrible, and their opponents were ultra-defensive but the Socceroos generated just four shots on target all night.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh managed a shot through Rakib Hossain in the 33rd minute - though it was so far off target it literally ended up in the car park.
Irankunda provided a glimpse of his precocious talents in the 58th minute when he beat a defender and danced into the area.
